items.title: Volcanic Lava Rocks in Russia
items.description:
Free video about volcanic rocks. This video was created for you by http://epsos.de and can be re-used for free under the creative commons license with the attribution of epSos.de as the original author of this volcanic rocks video.

Thank you for supporting the creative commons movement !!

The volcanic rocks or extrusive are those igneous rock that formed by cooling wash in the Earth's surface or magma. The rapid cooling of magma or lava turns into volcanic rock makes many small crystals are formed, also called microcrystals or fine grains in these rocks. Rapid cooling may also be full or partially composed of volcanic rocks glass. The most common volcanic rocks on Earth are the basalt followed by the andesite. Other volcanic rocks are rhyolite, the dacite and traquita to name a few.

Volcanic rocks can be divided into those with no crystals visible to the naked eye, ie they have texture aphanitic, and those crystals visible to the naked eye, ie texture phaneritic. When large crystals, highlighting in the array is called porphyritic texture or porphyritic.

The differentiation of the magma from which the volcanic rocks produces its chemical composition can gradually vary in their ascent to the surface, resulting in different volcanic rocks. In turn, the inicales differences in composition of magmas, the assimilation of host rocks, or magma mixing, result in these differentiation processes follow different trends.

If cooling occurs slowly subsurface rocks form with crystals large referred plutonic rocks or intrusive, whereas if cooling occurs rapidly on the surface, for example, after eruption, rocks formed with invisible crystals known as rocks volcanic or extrusive. Most of the 700 types of igneous rocks that have been described are formed on the surface of the crust. Examples of igneous rocks are the diorite, the rhyolite, the porphyry, the gabbro, the basalt and granite.

Igneous rocks make up approximately ninety-five percent of the top of the crust, but are hidden by a relatively thin layer but extensive sedimentary and metamorphic. Its minerals, and global chemical provide information on the composition of Earth's mantle, which comes magma originates igneous rocks, and temperature and pressure conditions prevailing when the rock was formed, or pre-existing rock that is melted.

The Lava is magma during its ascent through the crust, reaches the surface. When it surfaces, lava usually has temperatures ranging between 700 ° C and 1200 ° C. Unlike the magma cools slowly deep underground. Volcanoes are the first group formed by the eruption of lava and can be of many types, from smooth basalt volcanoes and surface slopes stepped up ash and lava cones typical andesite and rhyolite. Volcanoes can form boiler if the dome collapses inward, forming a crater. These characteristics often form lakes in it, then forming the lava in an island that is the new cone.

The lava domes are a mass of lava whose viscosity prevents you descend the flanks of the volcano and that accumulates on top of the chimney supply. The edges of the domes generally have very steep flanks and often are in unstable areas.

The volcanic lava tubes or pipes are tunnels formed inside lava flows as it flows. The surface of the melt on contact with the air (which is much colder) solidifies creating an excellent thermal insulator for molten lava flow to maintain the temperature in the basement. This is a very common mechanism in most basaltic flows, and allows the lava reach long distances, even to drain into the sea only by having fluid inside the tube.

In exceptional cases, a volcanic cone can be filled without lava erupt. The lava fills the caldera is known as a lava lake. Lava lakes do not usually last long, either return to the magma chamber once the pressure decreases or in erupting lava or pyroclastic eruptions.

The rocks formed by lava of different volcanoes, differ greatly in appearance and composition. If a wash rhyolitic cooled quickly, it can become obsidian. If left with bubbles of gas, the same lava can form pumice. Instead, slowly cooling, forms the rhyolite.

The rock is then placed in its field petrographic by calculating the standard. Indeed the classification of igneous rocks is based on the presence and exclusion of major minerals, we must reconstruct the mineralogy of the rock as if it had fully crystallized. For example if we take a tholeiitic basalt, which is part of the rocks supersaturated silica, we never meet again porphyritic quartz in rock since silica tends to stay in the mesostasis, it is only with the calculation of the standard which shows virtual minerals that we can correctly determine the rock.

items.title: Russian helicopter crashed, 15 people killed in Siberia
items.description:
Fifteen people were killed in Russia on Thursday
when a civilian helicopter crashed in Siberia,
regional authorities said.
The Mi-8 helicopter, which was transporting 22
passengers and four crew members, crashed
outside the town of Igarka in Western Siberia,
some 2,800 kilometres (1,750 miles) northeast of
Moscow.
"Fifteen people were killed and 10 people were
hospitalised as a result of the crash," regional
transportation authorities said in a statement.
Contact with the helicopter -- which was headed to
an oil pumping station -- was lost just after 0400
GMT, some 15 minutes after takeoff from Igarka
airport, authorities said.
The regional branch of the emergencies ministry
said the helicopter had performed an emergency
landing but did not elaborate on what might have
caused the crash.
Prosecutors said they would investigate possible
safety violations.

items.title: Shocking Tiger and goat friends at Taman Safari Shkotovzsky, Russia as Tom and Jerry
items.description: Shocking Tiger and goat friends at Taman Safari Shkotovzsky, Russia as Tom and Jerry,,Extraordinary images show the unlikely friendship between Amur the tiger and a goat that should have been his lunch (left and right), at the Far Eastern Safari Park in Shkotovzsky, Russia. Not only has the goat managed to steal the tiger's heart, he has also muscled in on his bed, forcing the tiger to sleep on the roof of his shelter instead. Astonished keepers decided to name the goat Timur - meaning iron - in honour of its bravery.
